explanation: OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET — this macro is used to obtain 'impl' and may expand to code (or calls) that contain for loops; the macro body must be inspected to be sure no for loop violates the MISRA rule. OS_ObjectIndexFromToken — the static call graph shows the macro expands/uses this function; its implementation must be checked for any for loops or loop-counter usage that would affect compliance. OS_impl_queue_table — the macro may reference this table (e.g. indexing or iteration); its definition can reveal hidden loop constructs in the macro expansion. OS_impl_queue_internal_record_t — the structure type of 'impl'; its definition may be used by macro expansions or inline helpers that could include for loops. OS_object_token_t — the token type is dereferenced in the macro call (*token); its definition may affect how the macro/indexing is implemented. mq_timedsend — called in this function; although it is a library/system call, some platforms provide inline wrappers or macros that could contain for loops; include its declaration/implementation to rule that out. memset — could be a macro/inline implementation that uses loops on some targets; inspect to ensure no for-loop complications. errno, EINTR, ETIMEDOUT — error variable and constants used in the loop/condition handling; include to fully understand control-flow and to confirm there are no hidden macros or conditionally compiled code that introduce for loops tied to these symbols.
